newsitem.title: FINLAND: Markka bonds keep most gains, cut gap over Germany.
newsitem.headline: Markka bonds keep most gains, cut gap over Germany.

text.p: Bonds kept most gains in mid afternoon, with the 2006 yield down six basis points at 5.76 percent after an international spurt on encouraging comments from Fed Chairman Alan Greenspan overnight, dealers said.

Markka bonds outperformed Germany with the gap narrowing three basis points to 25, helped by the finance ministry's budget proposal which cut the planned budget deficit to 17 billion markka from 21 billion.

A Reuters poll of seven operators on Wednesday showed the Finnish yield gap over Bunds was expected to follow a narrowing trend to stand at 25 basis points a month ahead and 22 basis points at the year-end -- lower if pay hikes for next year are moderate and plans to launch EMU remain on track.
But operators who saw problems in next autumn's pay talks saw a wider spread at the year-end, and the highest forecast was 35 basis points, over twice the lowest 15 basis point forecast.
